New York Attorney General Letitia James Ready To Sue Trump And Family Members For Fraud
Republic Brief ^ | 09/16/2022 | Jeff Miller
https://republicbrief.com/ny-ag-ready-to-sue-trump-and-family-members-for-fraud/

Politics makes strange bedfellows.

Word is coming in that New York’s Attorney General has rejected a settlement offer from former President Donald Trump and is preparing to sue him and one of his kids.

Trump has accused NY Attorney General Letitia James of being a racist in the past. Now, another famous politician, a Democrat nonetheless, is accusing her of being “biased” and targeting him.

A year ago, Andrew Cuomo was compelled out of the New York governor’s office after a damning report about sex harassment was filed by James.

Cuomo has now filed an attorney ethics complaint against the state AG.

The state’s Attorney Grievance Committee received Cuomo’s 48-page complaint Tuesday.

“The complaint elaborates on disagreements with James that Cuomo has previously aired, including his claims that the report was inaccurate or misleading and that James was politically biased,” according to Business Insider.

It asks for an investigation and unspecified “appropriate action” against James and two of her special deputies, former acting US Attorney Joon Kim and employment lawyer Anne Clark.

In the midst of those accusations, James is going after Trump’s family.

Donald J. Trump’s lawyers have rejected an offer from the New York attorney general’s office to settle a hotly contested civil investigation into his real estate business, paving the way for a lawsuit accusing him of fraud, according to three people familiar with the case, the New York Times is reporting.

The attorney general, Letitia James, is also considering suing at least one of Mr. Trump’s adult children, the people said. Ivanka, Eric and Donald Trump Jr. have all been senior executives at Mr. Trump’s company, the Trump Organization.

If a Trump offspring is going to be sued for fraud, it is most likely to be Eric Trump. He was at the top of the Trump Organization while Trump was president.

Tax crimes charges pending in Manhattan against the Trump Organization differ from this potential fraud case.

Letitia James
https://gab.com/Agitators/posts/107835619471548990

Kirsten Gillibrand wants to help solve the Big Apple’s shelter crisis by relocating newly arrived migrants to upstate cities — which could use the population boost to qualify for pork-barrel federal funds as she seeks reelection, The Post has learned.Gillibrand (D-NY) has floated the idea to City Hall and discussed it with Mayor Eric Adams on Tuesday during a closed-door meeting in Washington, a source familiar with the matter said.The senator has also contacted Gov. Kathy Hochul’s office to seek her support, a second source told The Post.City Councilmember Gale Brewer (D-Manhattan) confirmed Gillibrand recently pitched the idea to her as well.“She told me that arrangements could be made for housing assistance, childcare, school assistance and working,” Brewer said. “She seemed to feel this is a solution for some who might want to go.”Gillibrand’s plan, if successful, could help the Albany native bring home the bacon to struggling locales as she looks ahead to a likely re-election bid in 2024, a DC source close to the senator said.Kirsten Gillibrandhttps://gab.com/Agitators/posts/107632186546608508Senator, D, NYContact:http://gillibrand.senate.govhttps://twitter.com/SenGillibrandhttps://instagram.com/kirstengillibrandhttps://facebook.com/KirstenGillibrandPeople in PoliticsPage 1 https://gab.com/Agitators/posts/108487037613807087
_source.contentraw:
Kirsten Gillibrand wants to send NYC migrants upstate so cities could get federal funds
NY Post ^ | 09/16/2022 | Bernadette Hogan and Bruce Golding
https://nypost.com/2022/09/16/kirsten-gillibrand-wants-to-send-nyc-migrants-upstate-for-funding/

Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand wants to help solve the Big Apple’s shelter crisis by relocating newly arrived migrants to upstate cities — which could use the population boost to qualify for pork-barrel federal funds as she seeks reelection, The Post has learned.

Gillibrand (D-NY) has floated the idea to City Hall and discussed it with Mayor Eric Adams on Tuesday during a closed-door meeting in Washington, a source familiar with the matter said.

The senator has also contacted Gov. Kathy Hochul’s office to seek her support, a second source told The Post.

City Councilmember Gale Brewer (D-Manhattan) confirmed Gillibrand recently pitched the idea to her as well.

“She told me that arrangements could be made for housing assistance, childcare, school assistance and working,” Brewer said. “She seemed to feel this is a solution for some who might want to go.”

Gillibrand’s plan, if successful, could help the Albany native bring home the bacon to struggling locales as she looks ahead to a likely re-election bid in 2024, a DC source close to the senator said.

Kirsten Gillibrand
https://gab.com/Agitators/posts/107632186546608508
Senator, D, NY

card.description: The 50 new arrivals on Martha's Vineyard are being deported to the Joint Base Cape Cod located on mainland Massachusetts.
card.title: Martha's Vineyard Elites Deport Illegal Immigrants After 24 Hours

_source.content: Left-Wing Martha’s Vineyard Elites Deport Illegal Immigrants After Just 24 HoursThe Federalist ^ | September 16, 2022 | Tristan Justicehttps://thefederalist.com/2022/09/16/left-wing-marthas-vineyard-elites-deport-illegal-immigrants-after-just-24-hours/The 50 new arrivals on Martha’s Vineyard are being deported to the Joint Base Cape Cod located on mainland Massachusetts.Busses arrived in Edgartown, Mass., Friday morning to ship out the 50 illegal migrants who arrived at the New England destination at Martha’s Vineyard Wednesday night courtesy of Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis.According to the Vineyard Gazette, the mostly Venezuelan migrants will be bussed to a ferry that will take them to a military base on Cape Cod. Republican Gov. Charlie Baker announced the activation of up to 125 members of the state National Guard to coordinate relief efforts for what local residents declared a “humanitarian crisis.”“We are grateful to the providers, volunteers and local officials that stepped up on Martha’s Vineyard over the past few days to provide immediate services to these individuals,” Baker said in a Friday press release. “Our Administration has been working across state government to develop a plan to ensure these individuals will have access to the services they need going forward, and Joint Base Cape Cod is well equipped to serve these needs.”Lisa Belcastro, a local resident who manages the shelter at the island’s St. Andrew’s Episcopal Church where migrants slept for their two-night stay, said Thursday the migrants would have to move on because the wealthy island was full.“We certainly don’t have housing, we’re in a housing crisis as we are on this island,” Belcastro said. “We don’t have housing for 50 more people.”Federalist Editor Elle Purnell, however, outlined a dozen “stunning” vacation homes available to house the few dozen arrivals who inaugurated diversity on the majority-white island. While options run between $1,600 to $20,000 a night, New York City Democrat Mayor Eric Adams plans to spend up to $300 million to house the more than 6,000 migrants who’ve arrived in the Big Apple courtesy of Texas Gov. Greg Abbott over the next year. Poor Texas border towns, meanwhile, routinely see more than 7,000 new migrant arrivals on a daily basis.“Residents of Martha’s Vineyard overwhelmingly support illegal immigration and call for more diversity,” wrote DeSantis spokeswoman Christina Pushaw on Twitter. “Governor DeSantis was kind enough to grant their wishes.”The 50 new arrivals on Martha’s Vineyard, however, are now being deported to the Joint Base Cape Cod located on the mainland.
_source.contentraw:
Left-Wing Martha’s Vineyard Elites Deport Illegal Immigrants After Just 24 Hours
The Federalist ^ | September 16, 2022 | Tristan Justice
https://thefederalist.com/2022/09/16/left-wing-marthas-vineyard-elites-deport-illegal-immigrants-after-just-24-hours/

The 50 new arrivals on Martha’s Vineyard are being deported to the Joint Base Cape Cod located on mainland Massachusetts.

Busses arrived in Edgartown, Mass., Friday morning to ship out the 50 illegal migrants who arrived at the New England destination at Martha’s Vineyard Wednesday night courtesy of Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis.

According to the Vineyard Gazette, the mostly Venezuelan migrants will be bussed to a ferry that will take them to a military base on Cape Cod. Republican Gov. Charlie Baker announced the activation of up to 125 members of the state National Guard to coordinate relief efforts for what local residents declared a “humanitarian crisis.”

“We are grateful to the providers, volunteers and local officials that stepped up on Martha’s Vineyard over the past few days to provide immediate services to these individuals,” Baker said in a Friday press release. “Our Administration has been working across state government to develop a plan to ensure these individuals will have access to the services they need going forward, and Joint Base Cape Cod is well equipped to serve these needs.”

Lisa Belcastro, a local resident who manages the shelter at the island’s St. Andrew’s Episcopal Church where migrants slept for their two-night stay, said Thursday the migrants would have to move on because the wealthy island was full.

“We certainly don’t have housing, we’re in a housing crisis as we are on this island,” Belcastro said. “We don’t have housing for 50 more people.”

Federalist Editor Elle Purnell, however, outlined a dozen “stunning” vacation homes available to house the few dozen arrivals who inaugurated diversity on the majority-white island. While options run between $1,600 to $20,000 a night, New York City Democrat Mayor Eric Adams plans to spend up to $300 million to house the more than 6,000 migrants who’ve arrived in the Big Apple courtesy of Texas Gov. Greg Abbott over the next year. Poor Texas border towns, meanwhile, routinely see more than 7,000 new migrant arrivals on a daily basis.

“Residents of Martha’s Vineyard overwhelmingly support illegal immigration and call for more diversity,” wrote DeSantis spokeswoman Christina Pushaw on Twitter. “Governor DeSantis was kind enough to grant their wishes.”

The 50 new arrivals on Martha’s Vineyard, however, are now being deported to the Joint Base Cape Cod located on the mainland.

numbers by collapsing". No, the NIH still does NOT advise using ivermectin to treat Covid-19 except in clinical trials. The NIH is years behind the data and efficacy, and thousands have died because of it.

loans. Unconstitutional ❗ Congress controls the purse strings.

The FBI seized Mike Lindell's phone at a Hardee's drive thru in Minnesota. They asked him about Dominion voting machines in Colorado. Unconstitutional ❗

Lord!’ will enter the Kingdom of Heaven. Only those who actually do the will of my Father in heaven will enter. On judgment day many will say to me, ‘Lord! Lord! We prophesied in your name and cast out demons in your name and performed many miracles in your name.’ But I will reply, ‘I never knew you. Get away from me, you who break God’s laws.’(”)JOHN 6:29 (NLT)Jesus told them, “This is the only work God wants from you: Believe in the one he has sent.”GALATIANS 3:28-29 (NLT)There is no longer Jew or Gentile, slave or free, male and female. For you are all one in Christ Jesus. And now that you belong to Christ, you are the true children of Abraham. You are his heirs, and God’s promise to Abraham belongs to you.2 TIMOTHY 3:5 (NLT)They will act religious, but they will reject the power that could make them godly. Stay away from people like that!https://www.biblegateway.com/There are literally dozens of each, cults and false religions.A cult is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong “Jesus”, but that’s another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about the finished work of Jesus or His Resurrection. There’s ALWAYS someone else as a “leader”. Examples: Charles “Taze” Russell of Jehovah’s Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on.An incorrect version of “Jesus” exists in ANY cult which includes those “salvation by works” people. It’s totally impossible to “earn a gift”. No “Jesus” in false religions. One doesn’t HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn’t teach anything like either “salvation by works” or “religion” (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord). By contrast, salvation is “Just Jesus. No artificial anything”. (“The Gospel ONLY”, in other words – Keyword: “ONLY”). Someone born again (or “born from above” – or “born anew” – John 3:1-6 – https://biblehub.com/greek/509.htm ) is only qualified to teach the new covenant (see 2 Corinthians 3:4-11 for more information). Forever’s a long time.Will cheerfully do what The Lord says instead. Feel free to take matters up with The Author if there’s some “problem” with how He writes His Own Book. That 1-on-1 with The Lord happens with 100% of everyone whether he or she “believes that way or not” (see Hebrews 9:27-28). Confidence on the Day of Judgment is critical. Psalm 118:8 says that it’s better to trust in The Lord than it is to put confidence in man.Over the years, there has been quite a lot taught about Christianity. The problem is, many of those things simply are not in The Bible. Makes one wonder at times: Human opinion versus The Lord’s opinion...Wonder who would win? Additionally - Legalism: Sad, huh?Sometimes love must be tough. The desire is for everyone to hit as close to 100% as possible of everything for which The Lord created that person, self included. No one is perfect and there is no one righteous...AT ALL (Isaiah 64:6, John 8:7, Romans 3:10-12, Romans 3:21-26, 1 John 1:8-10). According to Ephesians 5:11, instructions are to have nothing to do with the deeds of darkness but rather expose them. EVERYONE needs a savior (1 John 1:8-10). As long as a person is able to identify from the heart with the death, burial and resurrection of Jesus...ONLY...that person is justified (Galatians 2:20-21, Romans 5:10, Romans 6:5, 2 Corinthians 5:17). Anything above and beyond that is merely some human attempting to push some “religion”, or “sin management”, or “man-plan”. (SIDE NOTE: The term “Christ” is a title, not a name. It means either “The Anointed One” or “Messiah”.) Rather than ask, “What would Jesus do?” Perhaps instead inquire as to what He may be doing in you.“...and the truth shall set you free” (John 8:31-32). (Proverbs 3:5-6, Proverbs 27:17, Hebrews 4:12, Hebrews 10:14, Jude 1:23, etc. are additional motives.)
_source.contentraw:
“I’m glad I listened,” before it’s too late ALWAYS sounds better than, “I wish I’d listened,” when it is.

MATTHEW 7:21-23 (NLT)
“Not everyone who calls out to me, ‘Lord! Lord!’ will enter the Kingdom of Heaven. Only those who actually do the will of my Father in heaven will enter. On judgment day many will say to me, ‘Lord! Lord! We prophesied in your name and cast out demons in your name and performed many miracles in your name.’ But I will reply, ‘I never knew you. Get away from me, you who break God’s laws.’(”)
JOHN 6:29 (NLT)
Jesus told them, “This is the only work God wants from you: Believe in the one he has sent.”
GALATIANS 3:28-29 (NLT)
There is no longer Jew or Gentile, slave or free, male and female. For you are all one in Christ Jesus. And now that you belong to Christ, you are the true children of Abraham. You are his heirs, and God’s promise to Abraham belongs to you.
2 TIMOTHY 3:5 (NLT)
They will act religious, but they will reject the power that could make them godly. Stay away from people like that!
https://www.biblegateway.com/

There are literally dozens of each, cults and false religions.

A cult is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong “Jesus”, but that’s another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about the finished work of Jesus or His Resurrection. There’s ALWAYS someone else as a “leader”. Examples: Charles “Taze” Russell of Jehovah’s Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on.

An incorrect version of “Jesus” exists in ANY cult which includes those “salvation by works” people. It’s totally impossible to “earn a gift”. No “Jesus” in false religions. One doesn’t HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn’t teach anything like either “salvation by works” or “religion” (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord).

By contrast, salvation is “Just Jesus. No artificial anything”. (“The Gospel ONLY”, in other words – Keyword: “ONLY”). Someone born again (or “born from above” – or “born anew” – John 3:1-6 – https://biblehub.com/greek/509.htm ) is only qualified to teach the new covenant (see 2 Corinthians 3:4-11 for more information). Forever’s a long time.

Will cheerfully do what The Lord says instead. Feel free to take matters up with The Author if there’s some “problem” with how He writes His Own Book. That 1-on-1 with The Lord happens with 100% of everyone whether he or she “believes that way or not” (see Hebrews 9:27-28). Confidence on the Day of Judgment is critical. Psalm 118:8 says that it’s better to trust in The Lord than it is to put confidence in man.

Over the years, there has been quite a lot taught about Christianity. The problem is, many of those things simply are not in The Bible. Makes one wonder at times: Human opinion versus The Lord’s opinion...Wonder who would win? Additionally - Legalism: Sad, huh?

Sometimes love must be tough. The desire is for everyone to hit as close to 100% as possible of everything for which The Lord created that person, self included. No one is perfect and there is no one righteous...AT ALL (Isaiah 64:6, John 8:7, Romans 3:10-12, Romans 3:21-26, 1 John 1:8-10). According to Ephesians 5:11, instructions are to have nothing to do with the deeds of darkness but rather expose them. EVERYONE needs a savior (1 John 1:8-10). As long as a person is able to identify from the heart with the death, burial and resurrection of Jesus...ONLY...that person is justified (Galatians 2:20-21, Romans 5:10, Romans 6:5, 2 Corinthians 5:17). Anything above and beyond that is merely some human attempting to push some “religion”, or “sin management”, or “man-plan”. (SIDE NOTE: The term “Christ” is a title, not a name. It means either “The Anointed One” or “Messiah”.)
Rather than ask, “What would Jesus do?” Perhaps instead inquire as to what He may be doing in you.

“...and the truth shall set you free” (John 8:31-32). (Proverbs 3:5-6, Proverbs 27:17, Hebrews 4:12, Hebrews 10:14, Jude 1:23, etc. are additional motives.)
